Source code for hamcalc.math.equiv

"""hamcalc.meth.equiv -- Unit Conversions

Simple Units

-   Capacitance
-   Current
-   Degrees / Radians
-   Inductance
-   Length / Distance
-   Resistance
-   Temperature
-   Time
-   MPG/KPL

Plus, the Frequencies/Wavelengths is both units conversion and a :math:`c=\lambda\nu`  **Solver**.
"""

from hamcalc.lib import Unit, Standard_Unit, AttrDict


[docs]class FARAD( Standard_Unit ):
    """Farad"""
    name= "F"



[docs]class AMPERE( Standard_Unit ):
    """Ampere"""
    name= "A"



[docs]class RADIAN( Standard_Unit ):
    """Radian"""
    name= "R"



[docs]class HERTZ( Standard_Unit ):
    """Hertz"""
    name= "Hz"



[docs]class HENRY( Standard_Unit ):
    """Henry"""
    name= "H"



[docs]class METRE( Standard_Unit ):
    """Metre"""
    name= "M"



[docs]class OHM( Standard_Unit ):
    """Ohm"""
    name= "Ω"



[docs]class CELSIUS( Standard_Unit ):
    """Degrees C"""
    name="°C"



[docs]class SECOND( Standard_Unit ):
    """Second"""
    name= "Sec"



[docs]class MPG( Standard_Unit ):
    """Miles per Gallon (US)"""
    name= "MPG"



[docs]def freq_wavelength( **kw ):
    """Solver for frequency-wavelength problems in Standard units
    of meters and Hertz.

    :param f: Frequency in Hz
    :param l: Wavelength in m
    """
    c= 299792.458
    args= AttrDict( kw )
    if 'f' in args:
        args.l= 1000*c/f
    elif 'l' in args:
        args.f = c/l/1000
    return args
